title: Logit Disagreement: OoD Detection with Bayesian Neural Networks
author: Kevin Raina (Department of Mathematics and Statistics, University of Ottawa), ..., Kevin Raina (Department of Mathematics and Statistics, University of Ottawa)
relevance_why: The method proposed in this paper focuses on measuring epistemic uncertainty, which is relevant to tasks involving uncertainty quantification in audio processing, such as speech enhancement and music generation.
background: Detection of out-of-distribution samples in deep learning models, which is crucial for ensuring model reliability in various applications.
contribution: This paper introduces new epistemic uncertainty scores based on measuring disagreement in logit values of Bayesian Neural Networks to enhance out-of-distribution detection capabilities, achieving improved performance over traditional methods.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods like mutual information were limited in distinguishing noisy data effectively, leading to poor OoD detection performance.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work improves upon those methods by using disagreement scores derived from logit values, which better reflect model uncertainty.

key_innovation: The use of maximum logits across samples as a proxy for likelihoods to create a more reliable measure of epistemic uncertainty in Bayesian Neural Networks.
real_world_impact: This framework can be vital for developing systems that require high reliability in uncertain environments, such as autonomous vehicles or medical diagnosis tools.
limitations: No explicit limitations are mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.Bayesian Neural Networks: **Bayesian Neural Networks** are neural networks that incorporate Bayesian inference principles to estimate the uncertainty in their weights and predictions.
new_terms.epistemic uncertainty: **Epistemic uncertainty** refers to the uncertainty in a model due to insufficient knowledge or data, which can potentially be reduced by gathering more training data.
